component.name: FreeRTOS_IP
component.detail: FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP is a scalable, open source and thread safe TCP/IP stack for FreeRTOS.

component.name: FreeRTOS_Kernel
component.detail: FreeRTOS kernel is a real-time operating system (RTOS) designed for building embedded microcontroller applications.

component.name: LittleFS
component.detail: LittleFS is a lightweight, fail-safe filesystem designed for microcontrollers.

app.name: (Ethernet) Minimal sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates basic TCP/IP functionality using FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP library over Ethernet connection.

app.name: Secure bootloader sample project
app.description: This demonstration is used together with OTA sample project to provide a secure boot.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub functionality using AWS services with Ethernet connection.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT sample project (TLS with TSIP)
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub functionality using AWS services with Ethernet connection in TSIP configuration.

app.name: (Cellular) PubSub/MQTT sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub functionality using AWS services with Cellular(RYZ014A) connection.

app.name: (Wi-Fi) PubSub/MQTT sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub functionality using AWS services with Wi-Fi(DA16600) connection.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet Provisioning functionality, followed by PubSub using AWS services with Ethernet connection.

app.name: (Cellular) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet Provisioning functionality, followed by PubSub using AWS services with Cellular(RYZ014A) connection.

app.name: (Wi-Fi) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet Provisioning functionality, followed by PubSub using AWS services with Wi-Fi(DA16600) connection.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT with Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub and OTA update functionality (simultaneously) using AWS services with Ethernet connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT with Over-the-air(OTA) update sample project (TLS with TSIP)
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub and OTA update functionality (simultaneously) using AWS services with Ethernet connection in TSIP configuration. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Cellular) PubSub/MQTT with Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub and OTA update functionality (simultaneously) using AWS services with Cellular(RYZ014A) connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Wi-Fi) PubSub/MQTT with Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates PubSub and OTA update functionality (simultaneously) using AWS services with Wi-Fi(DA16600) connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Ethernet) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning and Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet provisioning functionality followed by PubSub and OTA update (simultaneously) using AWS services with Ethernet connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Cellular) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning and Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet provisioning functionality followed by PubSub and OTA update (simultaneously) using AWS services with Cellular(RYZ014A) connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.

app.name: (Wi-Fi) PubSub/MQTT with Fleet Provisioning and Over-the-air (OTA) update sample project
app.description: This demonstration illustrates Fleet provisioning functionality followed by PubSub and OTA update (simultaneously) using AWS services with Wi-Fi(DA16600) connection. Note: This project requires bootloader project.
